title: Save Your Miles: This Edit Brings Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc Luxury Right to Your Home
description: Checking out your cart is like checking into the hotel.
author: Nikki Chwatt
excerpt: Checking out your cart is like checking into the hotel.
text: If you're planning to travel to Europe this summer but haven't made any reservations yet, time is running out. For those not flying overseas, I'm right there with you. The fear of missing out might already be creeping in after seeing pictures of Kate Hudson in Greece and Sofia Richie Grainge in the French Riviera. The silver lining is that we're saving our miles and money, and using girl math, we can spend on other things. For me, that means purchasing summer pieces that will make me feel like I'm at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc alongside Richie Grainge without actually being there.Elevating my wardrobe with items that capture Mediterranean vibes—like white linen pants, a designer one-piece swimsuit, and a printed headscarf—is just one aspect. However, enhancing my home is another crucial component. This will really trick my mind into thinking I'm sipping a Hugo spritz at the hotel bar or lounging in a seaside cabana when I'm really in my NYC one-bedroom apartment drinking my matcha out of a mug.To give you a better idea of what I mean, I've curated a selection of 36 fashion and home décor items that will transport you to Europe—all without the stress of packing, waiting in the airport, and worrying about whether your suitcase made it or not. Keep scrolling. ZARA Contrast Piping T-Shirt When walking around the hotel in the morning or in the evening during golden hour, pair this top with a white poplin skirt and flip-flops. MANGO Flared Cotton Skirt Mango doesn't know it yet, but its new skirt will be a best seller in a few weeks. Yellow Rose Marina Statement Stud Earrings in Vintage Silver These aren't vintage, but they do look it. THEMIS Z Kyma Painted Porcelain Serving Platter This serving tray is giving "chic Italian restaurant" vibes. Staud Giada Fish-Print Crewneck Sweater The fisherman aesthetic, which consists of sardine-adorned clothes and fish-shaped jewelry, is trending hard right now. Little Moon Airplush Cotton Coastal Palazzo Pants If you buy anything from this edit, make it these easy and versatile linen drawstring pants. Bananas, apples, peaches, and any other fruit you name belong in this cute bowl. Hill House Home The Hotel Robe Treat yourself to hotel luxury by hanging a fresh robe in your closet. Then put cozy slippers next to your bed. MANGO Satin-Finish Hoop Bikini Top Classic, timeless, and chic. MANGO Paisley-Print Wideleg Pants Everyone needs a pair of printed wide-leg pants this summer. Source Unknown Raffia Bucket Bag Shh, no one knows about this gorgeous raffia bucket bag yet. Be the first to grab it. AEYDE Melody Leather Flip Flops These sandals come in a bunch of colors, but this hue is my favorite because I love how the burgundy patent leather contrasts against the white stitching. Gucci GG Terrycloth Jersey Jacquard Swimsuit The exact swimsuit Richie Grainge wore at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc last week. MANGO Wide-Leg Pants With Elastic Waist Richie Grainge just paired her Gucci one-piece swimsuit with navy pants, so I want to do the same. I'm not ashamed to admit that I own at least five pairs of Le Specs sunglasses. Toteme Striped Monogram Print Scarf When a colleague pointed out this discounted designer silk scarf, the whole Who What Wear editorial team ran to get it. A stylish linen dress under $20? It doesn't get better than that. The hot temperatures are just around the corner. Get ready with a stylish fan in hand. Shells are everywhere, but I'm not complaining. Give me them all. MANGO Open-Back Crochet Top I love the style of this top and how the crochet adds nice texture and visual interest to any outfit. If you haven't heard, the It girl trend of the summer is a yellow slip skirt. Richie Grainge and Gigi Hadid were both recently spotted wearing one. Business & Pleasure Co. The Al Fresco Sun Lounger Cushion I wish I had a home with a pool so I could decorate my backyard with these lounge chairs. Moda Domus Carnation Porcelain Jug There's something about pouring your water out of a decorative jug that makes you feel rich. MANGO Long Cotton Pajama Pants Pottery Barn St. Tropez Scalloped Beach Umbrella If you sit in the sun, protect your skin with this chic umbrella and SPF, of course. Pottery Barn Moroccan Handcrafted Recycled Drinking Glasses For those who didn't know, the pool restaurant at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc sets its tables with blue drinking glasses. Oetker Collection Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc Cap Wear this around the city to trick people into thinking you actually visited Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc. COS Clean Cut Regular T-Shirt Solid white T-shirts aren't out, but fashion people everywhere are reaching for striped tees more. J.Crew Stratus Short in Linen The lightweight linen fabric and comfortable elastic band will have me reaching for these all summer. Great Bay Home Cotton Velour Beach Towels Striped towels are a must. Misette Fête Embroidered Linen Napkins Whether you hang these on your oven or set them on the table, these small but mighty napkins will transform your home into a Mediterranean oasis. Zw Collection Satin Volume Dress No one will believe you when you tell them this dress is from Zara. Open Edit Tori Kitten Heel Sandals Here at Who What Wear, we seriously can not get enough of these comfy and cute kitten heels. They come in a ton of neutral colors and can be used to dress up jeans or shorts. The Vin just launched last week with this sardine-shaped bag. How chic. Your bottle of wine or champagne deserves to be dressed up too. Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
html:
If you're planning to travel to Europe this summer but haven't made any reservations yet, time is running out. For those not flying overseas, I'm right there with you. The fear of missing out might already be creeping in after seeing pictures of Kate Hudson in Greece and Sofia Richie Grainge in the French Riviera. The silver lining is that we're saving our miles and money, and using girl math, we can spend on other things. For me, that means purchasing summer pieces that will make me feel like I'm at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc alongside Richie Grainge without actually being there.

Elevating my wardrobe with items that capture Mediterranean vibes—like white linen pants, a designer one-piece swimsuit, and a printed headscarf—is just one aspect. However, enhancing my home is another crucial component. This will really trick my mind into thinking I'm sipping a Hugo spritz at the hotel bar or lounging in a seaside cabana when I'm really in my NYC one-bedroom apartment drinking my matcha out of a mug.

To give you a better idea of what I mean, I've curated a selection of 36 fashion and home décor items that will transport you to Europe—all without the stress of packing, waiting in the airport, and worrying about whether your suitcase made it or not. Keep scrolling.

ZARA

Contrast Piping T-Shirt

When walking around the hotel in the morning or in the evening during golden hour, pair this top with a white poplin skirt and flip-flops.

MANGO

Flared Cotton Skirt

Mango doesn't know it yet, but its new skirt will be a best seller in a few weeks.

Yellow Rose

Marina Statement Stud Earrings in Vintage Silver

These aren't vintage, but they do look it.

THEMIS Z

Kyma Painted Porcelain Serving Platter

This serving tray is giving "chic Italian restaurant" vibes.

Staud

Giada Fish-Print Crewneck Sweater

The fisherman aesthetic, which consists of sardine-adorned clothes and fish-shaped jewelry, is trending hard right now.

Little Moon

Airplush Cotton Coastal Palazzo Pants

If you buy anything from this edit, make it these easy and versatile linen drawstring pants.

Bananas, apples, peaches, and any other fruit you name belong in this cute bowl.

Hill House Home

The Hotel Robe

Treat yourself to hotel luxury by hanging a fresh robe in your closet.

Then put cozy slippers next to your bed.

MANGO

Satin-Finish Hoop Bikini Top

Classic, timeless, and chic.

MANGO

Paisley-Print Wideleg Pants

Everyone needs a pair of printed wide-leg pants this summer.

Source Unknown

Raffia Bucket Bag

Shh, no one knows about this gorgeous raffia bucket bag yet. Be the first to grab it.

AEYDE

Melody Leather Flip Flops

These sandals come in a bunch of colors, but this hue is my favorite because I love how the burgundy patent leather contrasts against the white stitching.

Gucci

GG Terrycloth Jersey Jacquard Swimsuit

The exact swimsuit Richie Grainge wore at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc last week.

MANGO

Wide-Leg Pants With Elastic Waist

Richie Grainge just paired her Gucci one-piece swimsuit with navy pants, so I want to do the same.

I'm not ashamed to admit that I own at least five pairs of Le Specs sunglasses.

Toteme

Striped Monogram Print Scarf

When a colleague pointed out this discounted designer silk scarf, the whole Who What Wear editorial team ran to get it.

A stylish linen dress under $20? It doesn't get better than that.

The hot temperatures are just around the corner. Get ready with a stylish fan in hand.

Shells are everywhere, but I'm not complaining. Give me them all.

MANGO

Open-Back Crochet Top

I love the style of this top and how the crochet adds nice texture and visual interest to any outfit.

If you haven't heard, the It girl trend of the summer is a yellow slip skirt. Richie Grainge and Gigi Hadid were both recently spotted wearing one.

Business & Pleasure Co.

The Al Fresco Sun Lounger Cushion

I wish I had a home with a pool so I could decorate my backyard with these lounge chairs.

Moda Domus

Carnation Porcelain Jug

There's something about pouring your water out of a decorative jug that makes you feel rich.

MANGO

Long Cotton Pajama Pants

Pottery Barn

St. Tropez Scalloped Beach Umbrella

If you sit in the sun, protect your skin with this chic umbrella and SPF, of course.

Pottery Barn

Moroccan Handcrafted Recycled Drinking Glasses

For those who didn't know, the pool restaurant at Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc sets its tables with blue drinking glasses.

Oetker Collection

Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc Cap

Wear this around the city to trick people into thinking you actually visited Hotel du Cap-Eden-Roc.

COS

Clean Cut Regular T-Shirt

Solid white T-shirts aren't out, but fashion people everywhere are reaching for striped tees more.

J.Crew

Stratus Short in Linen

The lightweight linen fabric and comfortable elastic band will have me reaching for these all summer.

Great Bay Home

Cotton Velour Beach Towels

Striped towels are a must.

Misette

Fête Embroidered Linen Napkins

Whether you hang these on your oven or set them on the table, these small but mighty napkins will transform your home into a Mediterranean oasis.

Zw Collection

Satin Volume Dress

No one will believe you when you tell them this dress is from Zara.

Open Edit

Tori Kitten Heel Sandals

Here at Who What Wear, we seriously can not get enough of these comfy and cute kitten heels. They come in a ton of neutral colors and can be used to dress up jeans or shorts.

The Vin just launched last week with this sardine-shaped bag. How chic.

Your bottle of wine or champagne deserves to be dressed up too.

Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
